about_the_game:
Artificial Fright is a hauntingly atmospheric horror game where you take control of a half-damaged assistant robot on a mission to uncover what happened in a world gone wrong.



For frequent updates, please join our !

Explore the depths of an old, rusty warehouse filled with unknown threats, and manage your systems carefully to avoid detection. With tank controls and system management for visual, audio, locomotion, interaction, lights, and proximity, this game will keep you on the edge of your seat. Use a Unix-like terminal to activate, deactivate, and manage your systems and inventory, integrating new commands from data drives found throughout the level. But be careful not to activate too many systems at once, or you risk attracting more threats and breaking down further. Navigate the warehouse and find a way out before it's too late. Immerse yourself in the game's handcrafted pixel-art textures created by Sephra and experience a truly chilling atmosphere.

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-4460
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes

short_description: Artificial Fright is a tense horror survival game where you play as an assistant robot in an old, abandoned warehouse. Explore your surroundings, conserve your battery power, and manage your systems using a Unix-like terminal.
